title: Margins
content:
# Margins

Margins are used to create space around elements, outside of any defined borders.

## Centering

`margin: 0 auto;` will center the divs in their containing elements. The 0 sets the top and bottom margins to 0 pixels. The auto value instructs the browser to adjust the left and right margins until the element is centered within its containing element.


- This has to be applied to the child element no to the parent, this will center the child element.




:::note note
* In order to center an element, a width must be set for that element.
* Center aligning has no effect if the width property is not set (or set to 100%).
:::tip 
```css
div.headline {
  width: 400px;
  margin: 0 auto;
}
```

## Margin Collapse

* Horizontal margins (left and right), like padding, are always displayed and added together
 * Vertical margins do not add. Instead, the larger of the two vertical margins sets the distance between adjacent elements
